video_description: Shot with both 35mm/super16 with a motion control camera my friend built. Transfered and colored an the daVinci 2K. Big thanks to Eric F., Shannon H. and Brent H.!
title: Indian Motorcycle commercial

comments.author: MrLangley59

comments.text: I have﻿ a 02 Indian Spirit and I love it.
comments.author: stealth713

comments.text: I'd rather America make a real motorcycle than pose like a badass to make up for a complete lack of engineering. $35,000 for basically a Harley kit bike is not honoring the legacy of the engineers who founded Indian to be﻿ the BEST bike in America not the toy of rich credit car pirates.
comments.author: apostate001

comments.text: To those who have chimed in and dogged the Gilroy Indian's, I own a 2000 Chief. Ridden it for years. I LOVE IT. Now,﻿ when I hear "This Indian is just a copy of a Harley"... well, Harley copied the Indian first! Do your history. I think it is brilliant for a company that made the FIRST american motorcycle, had their designs ripped off and lost their sales... to come back and build a bike likes these after someone else iron out the kinks. After all, this is America. This is how we roll lol.
comments.author: ORTHMANCUSTOMS

comments.text: Indian Motorcycle looks and performs nothing like a Harley Davidson!! Just ride an Indian and you will find out. Indian was the first Motorcycle and the company was incorporated in 1901, harley came on the scene after copying﻿ the Indian Motorcycle in 1904. Read your history. I own a 2009 Indian Chief Roadmaster.
comments.author: stephenabm

comments.text:
Indian Motorcycle looks and performs nothing like a Harley Davidson!! Just ride an Indian and you will find out. Indian was the first Motorcycle and the company was incorporated in 1901, harley came on the scene after﻿ copying the Indian Motorcycle in 1904. Read your history. I own a 2009 Indian Chief Roadmaster.

Indian uses a proprietary 105 CI Power Plus Engine. No SS engines are used!!
comments.author: stephenabm

comments.text: Indian has never claimed to be a "bad ass" motorcycle company. The design is to honor the classic "Indian" design. Get over the Harley comparisons and get over the price tag. If you want one buy one, if you don't like them dont buy one. I have a 2000 Chief and it﻿ gives me exactly what I want, a cruiser with classic lines and and a great ride. Put them down all you want but let me tell you, when you pull into a gas station, 7 11, or just ride one down the street, 99% of the people appreciate it.
comments.author: hhdan

comments.text: Gonna be interesting to see what happens now that a company with some experience in building motorcycles﻿ owns the brand ( Polaris-Victory) Oh and BTW the bike in the commercial is 11 yrs old now and has 100k on it and still going strong.
comments.author: Firemandave1961

comments.text: i don't think Indian needs﻿ an Ad
